intro: Critoniopsis solorzanoana, commonly known as the Solorzano's mistflower, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is known for its small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom during the spring and early summer. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying alpine flora and plant adaptation to extreme climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
